title: I really need help with toxicity
body: I really need help with toxicity, this has occured more then once when I have been banned.I really need assistance i just got this account to plat and i dont want to lose my account.PLEASE PLEASE HELP ME I NEED HELP REFORMING.I keep flaming and i cant keep it under control.

replies.body:
There's some great advice in here but I think a lot of it focuses on the surface level, the symptoms of whatever's getting you riled up in game.  I would recommend taking a long, hard look at yourself and identifying what is causing you to flame.  I'll try sharing some stuff that has worked for me in the past.  

Is it your environment, are you stressed out at home/work/school and this is an outlet for that stress? Find a healthy way to relieve that stress - be it exercise, meditation, music - just find what works for you and helps you shake off that edge before you get in game (I also find that when these factors are stressing me out it carries over into my IRL interactions - so fixing it can be really important).  

Is it the game itself? Are you just not enjoying League right now? It's totally fine to take a break - a few hours, days, weeks.  Just make sure that you're spending your time on League because you're enjoying it, not just because you need something to spend time on.  Take a break, find another hobby, play another video game.  League will still be here when you come back!  I've been playing for over 7 years and there have been times where I just really wasn't enjoying it - and that carried over into my interactions in game.  

Is it the competitiveness? League can get pretty intense when things are on the line - be it LP, self esteem, etc.  Find a way to channel that intensity and competitiveness in a constructive way.  I'm extremely competitive and often find myself getting frustrated when things aren't going my way - the best way I found to handle that frustration was to focus inwards.  The only thing in League that you can actually control is yourself - your actions, your decisions, your mechanics.  Getting mad at things you can't control is about as useful as getting mad at the weather (all it does is make you even more frustrated, it certainly doesn't change the weather).  In ranked I focus intently on my own performance: I set personal objectives for every game (I'm going to {{champion:412}} Flay every {{champion:59}}  E-Q combo I can, hit 100 CS by 10 minutes, keep the river warded for the entire laning phase, etc.) so the only thing I am competing against is myself and my own expectations.  Every game is not a quest for ELO (keeping this mindset can get tough when it comes to end of season grinds, I won't lie), but a chance to improve myself and perform better than I did the game before.  

Sorry if this got kind of rambly, I hope it helps.  Happy to chat more!
_EDIT: Added a TL;DR. _

**TL;DR:** Take some time off and reflect on what's causing you to rage at your teammates.  Fix that, then come back to League! Introspection is your best defense against toxicity.

Ive had a chat ban twice in my 4 years of playing league, every since ive gotten creative with my insults i havent gotten any more chat bans in over 18 months. Now whenever i get angry at a teammate i just get very creative with my insults like "i hope you burn your toast" "your armpits are nasty" "i hope you step on a lego" and silly stuff like that. Most people will just chuckle, and you dont get reported, even if you do get reported the report system wont see anything wrong. The chat report system mostly just looks for all forms of sexist, racist, cursing, telling people to harm or kill themselves or family and friends. So if you avoid saying those things you should be fine. Just get creative with your insults "dear sir your skills are similar to that of a mr potato head"
Good luck man hope that helped a little

I guess intent matters, but is it really an insult anymore?  Don't get me wrong.  I respect you for being able to find a safe outlet for your anger.  But if you stop thinking of them as "insults" and consider them as "stress relieve", then you will truly be reformed and will have a healthy personality in and out of game.

I guess you could call it more of a baby step in the right direction. Lately if i have a bad or very un-fun game of league i just go play other games instead, there are so many cool games out there. I think taking a month long break from league eariler this year really helped me realize that League is just a video game, and if im not having fun then there is literally no point in queuing up again that day.

1. Disable all chat. This is life changing.
2. Literally mute everyone on your team the second you get in game.
3. Let everyone know in lobby that you will be doing this to avoid negativity but that you will use and respond to pings. You'll do your best to get ahead/roam/support/whatever you do to get your team ahead early.

This is literally it. Take chatting away from yourself before you even have the opportunity to send or read toxic chats in game.

The best people to ask about packet loss is actually the techs via a player support ticket.
They'll track it down and let you know how to fix it.
I know 'cause they helped me do the exact same thing a while ago.

Like everyone has said, muting everyone helps reduce the chances of flaming because you don't see what people type so you can't really respond.

Disabling all chat is also helpful because you don't see enemy taunts in the chat. They can still BM you or what not in game but you can't really help that.

However, what really is the problem is self control... You need to be able to not type out to people and control yourself. Take that frustration and channel it into something else. Talk it out or maybe use that frustration as fuel for another hobby. If league gets you worked up, stop playing, and go do something else that consumes that frustration for a positive result (like art, music, exercise, etc)
Remove the Enter key from your keyboard.
